docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ONE FATEFUL EVENING last spring Frances Epstein, a dressmaker in Riverdale, N.Y., lit a cigarette, flicked on her TV and found herself face to face with C. Everett Koop, Surgeon General of the United States. Dressed in a dark blue military uniform, bearded, huge, unsmiling, looking for the life of him like a vengeful biblical patriarch, the 71-year-old top doctor of the nation looked directly at Frances Epstein in Riverdale and asked, ''Why do people continue to smoke despite the known health hazards?
